title: Birds of a Feather
description: After Ted Barr quits the firm, Chuck, Leon, and Carrie have to try to hold the law practice together as Carrie and Ted head towards divorce.

title: Even Lawyers Sing the Blues
description: Leon runs into an old flame from his days as a radical student, and is surprised to learn who the father of her daughter is.

title: A Little Knowledge
description: Carrie represents a businessman charged with murdering his wife, but slowly learns the truth behind his motives for hiring her.

title: Sting Like a Butterfly
description: Chuck decides to back the comeback of an aging boxer, but his lack of experience creates problems for both of them.

title: A Matter of Honour
description: Chuck represents an emotionally disturbed 12-year-old boy charged with the murder of his stepfather, and who witnessed the suspicious death of his father.

title: Tango Bellarosa
description: Carrie represents a woman who discovers an immigration official is the same man who interrogated and tortured her in Brazil.

title: Baby Talk
description: Carrie represents a lesbian couple who acted as a surrogate for a heterosexual couple, and has no changed their minds about giving up the baby.

title: Star Struck
description: Leon's client fights to get back her medical research from an American company who plan to use it for a Star Wars type research program.

title: Desperate Alibi
description: Chuck defends a teen charged in a brutal gang beating of a gay man, and refuses to give the names of the others who were involved in the attack.

title: Assault
description: Carrie has trouble getting her life together after a clients husband sexual assaults her at the office and she has to testify against him in court.

title: Mr. Nice Guy
description: Carrie represents a man upset with the witness protection program.

title: Just One Kiss
description: Chuck is taken to trial over an incident in a young woman's hotel room...she says they slept together, he says she kissed him and he turned her down.

title: Judgement Call
description: Carrie is distraught when a problem client commits suicide, and her confident demeanor crumbles in the face of mounting work pressure.

title: Fever of the Blood
description: Leon represents a doctor who has been charged with negligence in the death of a young girl during a routine operation.

title: Lost and Lonely Hearts
description: Chuck's client wants to sue her dating service for setting her up on a less than desirable blind date

title: Take My Jokes, Please
description: Leon represents a stand up comedian who is counter suing his wife for not only a divorce, but for loss of humor.

title: Gold Rush
description: Chuck's involvement in a shady gold-mining company causes tension with Lisa; Leon's client, a condo developer, wants to evict an impoverished musician

title: Romeo and Carol
description: Leon represents a young mentally-handicapped couple who want to live together despite her mother's preventing them from even seeing each other.

title: I'll Be Home for Christmas
description: Leon defends an elderly client accused of destroying a beautiful Christmas display.

title: A Powerful Prison Story
description: Angry about the suspicious shooting death of his brother by a prison guard, a fellow inmate seeks advice from Carrie Barr; Olivia Novak joins the firm.

title: The Waiting Chair
description: Leon is asked to defend an American purse snatcher charged with murder in Florida, where he may face the electric chair.

title: Elliot vs. McTavish
description: Chuck finds himself at odds with his partners and wife when he represents the head of an anti-abortion group who has caused a woman to miscarry during a demonstration outside an abortion clinic.

title: State of Mind
description: A judge Carrie previously accused of racism hires her to defend him on a murder charge; A student charges Leon with sexual harassment.

title: The Homecoming
description: Leon is horrified when a TV newscaster names on-air a young offender he once represented, which is illegal.

title: Mondo Condo
description: Chuck's client needs help acquiring funding for condos; Olivia's client is a wheelchair-bound actor who was rejected for a handicapped role in a TV commercial.

title: Murder by Video
description: Carrie represents a young man charged with criminal negligence in the death of his morbid school friend; Olivia wants to hide a client's previous sports injury in a worker's compensation case.

title: Whose Woods Are These
description: Leon represents a radical environmentalist intent on saving a forest from destruction; Carrie sees another side of Nick; Lisa refuses to play the "corporate wife" for Chuck.

title: Act of Silence
description: Carrie struggles with her personal and legal ethics while defending a religious fanatic in a murder case; Leon negotiates an unusual sentence for a wealthy businesswoman.

title: Equal Partners
description: Leon is shocked and dismayed at Carrie's and Chuck's ignorance and intolerance when he represents an old friend with AIDS.

title: Cat and Mouse
description: On a challenge, Olivia and Carrie swap cases, with unexpected results; Chuck moves in with Leon after he and Lisa split up.

title: Basketball Story
description: Carrie's client, a young basketball star facing drug charges, refuses to tell her the truth; Sparks fly between Chuck and Olivia; Leon negotiates custody of a violin in a divorce settlement.

title: Principles
description: Chuck and Olivia try to help a young Mennonite who's been swindled out of millions of dollars; Leon is outraged over the city's treatment of the homeless.

title: Brotherhoods
description: Carrie endangers her relationship with Nick when she proves that his father figure is a crooked cop; Leon represents an adoptive mother in a custody case.

title: Beauties and Beasts
description: Chuck's client, a 15-year-old model, becomes infatuated with him; Leon helps a woman fighting to enforce her sister's living will; Carrie learns of Olivia's affair with Chuck.

title: In Search of a Dream
description: Leon's client wants to stay with his aboriginal foster parents, but his caseworker argues that their ancient beliefs endanger his life.

title: Slipping Through the Cracks
description: Carrie defends her young cousin Ricky, before learning that he has been diagnosed as a paranoid schizophrenic.

title: Conflict of Interest
description: Chuck's latest get-rich-quick scheme ends disastrously when he is accused of conflict of interest and charged with fraud. Olivia and Gloria expose a puppy mill.

title: World-Class City
description: Tensions between Leon and Chuck escalate when they learn they are representing opposing sides in a land-development dispute.

title: Soul Custody
description: Chuck's reckless business deals and his steamy affair with Olivia compel his estranged wife to apply for sole custody of their 2-year-old son.

title: Partners and Other Strangers
description: When Barr, Robinovitch and Tchobanian teeter on the verge of bankruptcy, two solutions present themselves.

title: Without Prejudice
description: Carrie defends Sarah Melchuck, a young policewoman charged in the shooting death of a black man.

title: See No Evil
description: Against all odds, Leon fights a malpractice suit against a major manufacturer of contact lenses, on behalf of blinded professional photographer.

title: The Cradle Will Rock
description: Carrie defends university professor Diane Abbot, a stoical single mother charged with criminal negligence in the accidental death of her infant son.

title: Complex Offer
description: Chuck and Olivia's collaboration on a case causes a lot of professional and personal tensions.

title: Film Noir
description: Olivia's association with a controversial filmmaker places her in danger; While Chuck has an affair with a socialite.

title: Confession
description: Leon and Nick join forces to uncover proof that an Olympic rower committed a murder six years ago, and thereby clear the name of Leon's former client who was sent to jail for the crime.

title: Home
description: Carrie becomes concerned about her client, a teen-age gang member accused of a fatal stabbing; While Olivia helps a rock star fight a paternity suit.

title: Blue Collar
description: Leon defends the rights of laid off factory workers who's factory is closed after a buy-out by an Ohio company who plans on moving production to Mexico.

title: Security Exchange
description: Chuck is implicated in an insider trading scheme involving Jennifer's father; Carrie defends a woman accused of beating her husband; Leon asks Olivia for advice.

title: The Bracelet
description: After a client skips town, Carrie finds herself becoming the legal guardian of her daughter; Alana decides to seek a divorce and asks Leon to represent her.

title: Leon's Story
description: Leon's father arrives in town to meet Alana, but finds himself arrested.

title: Wedding
description: Leon decides to represent a Guatemalan waiter falsely accused of thief, just days before his own wedding to Alana.

title: Godfather of Mimico
description: A newspaper is accused of libel after suggesting an Italian businessman has ties to organized crime.

title: Suite Sixteen
description: Carrie's handling of a case may put Kim danger. But Nick is determined to protect both of them; Olivia reveals her true feelings to Chuck.

title: Holy Thursday
description: Newly reunited Olivia and Chuck make a power play to gain control of the firm; Carrie is charged for disobeying a court order; Leon takes on a cosmetic company.

title: Spare Parts
description: Olivia's blue-collar past is revealed when her brothers show up; a judgeship falls in Alana's lap; Carrie and Dillon continue to clash over the Wendy Nelson case.

title: Double Agenda
description: Carrie is stunned when Dillon decides to prosecute Wendy Nelson; Leon tries to expose an immigration consultant; Alana is accepted as a judge, but in a different city.

title: Shadow Boxing
description: Determined to win a high-profile Hollywood client, Olivia has two unions fight each other; Leon uncovers fraud during a routine will inspection; Carrie hosts the annual firm barbecue.

title: Standard of Care
description: Chuck represents a man suing a hospital for malpractice, but is stunned to discover his son is receiving life saving treatment at the same hospital.

title: The Psychic
description: Carrie represents a woman who claims to have discovered her dead husband's body via a psychic vision; Leon gets involved in island politics by challenging a marijuana charge.

title: Softsell
description: Leon represents a mayoral candidate accused of sexual harassment; Leah receives early parole, and Carrie must face the prospect of losing Kim.

title: Divine Image
description: Leon announces he is running for mayor; Olivia is approached by a juror in her friend's sexual assault case; Carrie decides to fight Leah for custody of Kim.

title: Sanctuary
description: Johnny Marsh continues to harass Olivia; Leon is asked to represent a priest who is protecting an alleged terrorist; the custody battle for Kim takes a toll on Carrie.

title: Lies
description: Wanda asks Carrie to represent her fiancée who was arrested for burglary; Olivia represents an artist involved in a contract dispute, but finds out that her client is illiterate.

title: Tyger, Tyger
description: Kim's grandparents decide to fight for custody of Kim; Mayor Riley offers Leon a deal, in exchange for dropping out of the race; Chuck tries his first divorce case.

title: Murder
description: Chuck hires Nick to follow Olivia and Peter Garland; Leon files a libel suit against one of his opponents; the firm receives some shocking news about Peter Garland.

title: The Cookies Crumble
description: Carrie agrees to represent Chuck when he is arrested for the murder of Peter Garland; Olivia is convinced of Chuck's guilt; Leon and Jane embark on a one-night stand.

title: The Prosecution
description: The evidence is mounting against Chuck; Nick does some digging in Garland's past; Leon's campaign takes a hit when he refuses to publicly renounce Chuck.

title: Election Day
description: Peter Garland's connection to Johnny Marsh is uncovered, putting Olivia in the hot seat; Dillon suspects Brian is withholding evidence; Alana receives her transfer back to Toronto.

title: The Truth
description: New information on the murder of Peter Garland is revealed; Carrie accepts Dillon's proposal; Alana can't forgive Leon for his indiscretion; the jury returns with a verdict.

title: The Legacy of Stanley Wall
description: Chuck's case is officially closed, but Carrie, Leon, and Olivia discover that Brent Elliot, the administrator of Stanley Wall's estate, is hiding something.

title: The Harley
description: Dillon tells Veronica that he's got marriage on his mind. Olivia and the firm are being sued for five million dollars because Danny Hart recanted his story.

title: Presumed Toxic
description: Leon's impressive handling of the suit lands the firm a merger offer from high-powered international lawyer R.J. Williams.

title: Reasonable Doubt
description: Carrie and Alana struggle to keep their personal feelings in check at the trial of a sexual offender who preys on elderly women.

title: Shades of Difference
description: Tensions continue to rise between Dillon and Veronica when Dillon is assigned to prosecute a respected black community leader.

title: Questions of Dignity
description: Chuck's carelessness with a case earns a first-time offender a stiff sentence. While new office manager Rob starts construction on a luxurious workspace.

title: Sing for Me, Olivia
description: Olivia's father dies, leaving a sizable estate to Olivia. Carrie defends Veronica on assault charge.

title: Keeping Secrets
description: Olivia's mother, long-thought dead, suddenly appears on the scene to contest her late husband's will, prompting Olivia to seek Rob's help.

title: The Good Lawyer
description: Chuck defends a young man accused of a gang-related execution, and a lawyer on the same case is reluctant to join forces.

title: Hollywood North
description: Olivia represents a screenwriter who claims her script was changed without permission. Chuck defends a patriotic protester who was shooting at the cars at the border.

title: Eye of the Beholder
description: Leon finds himself sympathizing with the wife when he represents a man in a divorce case; Olivia considers using confidential information as leverage in a case.

title: Too Many Cooks
description: Chuck and Leon are hired for a polygamy case; Rob offers Laura Crosby a place at the firm, leaving the others wondering who she'll be replacing.

title: On Women and Independence
description: Leon represents a military man who refused to obey orders for reasons of conscience; Carrie returns with some important decisions to announce.

title: Children's Hour
description: BRT prepare to set up shop, but the lease to their office now belongs to R.J. While Carrie and Laura team up to help a battered wife.

title: Breach of Trust
description: Olivia's dreams comes true when R.J. offers her a partnership in his LA office, but is torn when he sues BRT for breach of contract. Carrie and Dillon finally get married.

title: November
description: The battle between R.J. Williams and BRT rages on. Chuck needs to request a second autopsy in a case. Carrie is killed by a hit and run driver.

title: After the Fall
description: Devastated by Carrie's death, Leon and Chuck accept Laura's help and she officially joins the firm; Leon gets new evidence that helps him defeat R.J. at trail.

title: The Phoenix
description: Olivia finds out that she's pregnant and the baby can be only Chuck's. She refuses R.J.'s marriage proposal, and asks to return to the firm.

title: BRT and Associates: A New Beginning
description: Chuck is involved in a prestigious murder case; Olivia feels neglected home alone pregnant; Leon returns from vacation with an announcement.

title: Affairs of the Heart
description: Olivia is in labor, but refuses to have Chuck in the delivery room; Leon latest case involves an immigration dispute; Dillon and Malony vie for the Senior Crown position.

title: Break-ups and Mergers
description: Laura feels threatened by Chuck and Olivia's closeness due to the baby; Dillon starts cracking under pressure; Rob lands a high-profile client.

title: Persistence of Vision
description: Olivia decides to produce a movie; Laura ends things with Chuck; Rob joins a dating service; Leon is stunned to discover Alana doesn't want to have children.

title: It's a Wise Child
description: Alana and Leon continue to quarrel over not having children; Olivia starts production on her movie; Rob turns his boxing match with Chuck into a charity event.

title: Rules of the Game
description: Chuck lands a high-profile murder case; Leon tries to secure the release of a refugee from prison; Rob and Chuck are sued because of the boxing match.

title: Never Say Die
description: Olivia turns to an organized-crime kingpin to secure funding for her film; Dillon continues to spiral downward; Chuck suggests living together to Olivia, for Emily's sake.

title: Lefter Than Thou
description: Laura represents a doctor charged with giving morphine to drug addicts; Molony continues harassing Dillon; Leon's latest immigration case begins to take a toll.

title: Believe the Children
description: Laura defends a former client accused of sexual abuse; Rob's new client wants to kick the poor out of a building; Alana and Leon wait for pregnancy results.

title: Thicker Than Water
description: Rob is stunned to discover his brother living on the streets; Olivia, intrigued by Chuck's latest client, tries to secure the film rights; Mercedes finds Dillon after a suicide attempt.

title: Best Interest of the Child
description: Chuck gives Olivia a bill for loss wages in the Bedol case; Mercedes keep a watch over Dillon after his release; Alana presides over an emergency hearing at the hospital.

title: Pride and Prejudice
description: Chuck lands another high-profile case, this time a murder with a hate crime attached to the charge; Olivia uses Emily as a weapon against Chuck; Laura gets involved in a mercy-killing case.

title: Forgiveness
description: Eva Paredes persuades Leon to represent a young Guatemalan soldier who claims he was forced to serve in the army against his will and is now seeking asylum in Canada.

title: Sex and Death
description: When an accident happens on-set, Olivia asks Chuck to defend Tom when he is arrested; Rob is caught between two feuding funeral directors; Alana suggests adoption to Leon.

title: Conduct Unbecoming
description: Olivia continues to struggle with the production of her film; Leon learns he is under investigation from the law society; Chuck sues Olivia for custody of Emily.

title: The Price
description: Leon is charged with misconduct and may face disbarment; Chuck and Olivia battle in court over Emily; the police question Rob about his dealings with Tassos Dimetrios.

title: Strange Bedfellows
description: Rob is charged with money laundering and the police seize Olivia's film; Chuck appeals Leon disbarment; Alana loses the baby; Tom proposes to Olivia.

title: Faking It
description: Determined to get Chuck off of her mind, Olivia accepts Tom's proposal; Rob is cleared by the law society; Laura, haunted by Brian, makes some poor choices on behalf of her client.

title: Strictly Business
description: Chuck and Olivia return from their Honeymoon; Laura suggests a billing contest to Olivia; Chuck agrees to fill in temporarily as senior partner.

title: Hasta La Vista
description: Eva Paredes clears Leon, but tragedy strikes; Rob meets an old flame through Laura; eager to win the billings contest, Olivia represents a controversial sexist author.

title: Truth or Dare
description: Olivia and Laura continue their billings war; Leon represents a Caucasian police cadet suing for reverse discrimination; Chuck permanently becomes senior partner.

title: But Not Forgotten
description: Laura represents a young boy accused of murder; an adjudicator position falls in Leon's lap; Rob latest client is making him miserable; a new articling student joins the firm.

title: Black and White in Color
description: Leon represents a black nurse who claims discrimination at her workplace; Rob and Nina's romance heats up; Leon and Alana decide meet their foster child.

title: Fit Punishment
description: Laura represents a child molester, but is up against Malony; Ben starts to spend time with Leon and Alana; Chuck finds a creative way to get his latest client off the hook.

title: What's Love Got to Do with It?
description: Malony's involvement with Laura's case leads to tragedy; Olivia is offered a TV commentator job; Leon represents a lesbian fighting for her deceased partner's pension.

title: Truth, Lies and Consequences
description: Rob represents an entrepreneur accused of stealing her former employer's clients; Olivia accepts the TV job, despite Chuck's misgivings; Leon and Alana officially adopt Ben.

title: Do the Right Thing
description: Olivia is fired from her TV job when she represents a TV journalist; Leon represents a teen suing his father for non-support; Chuck lands a new high-profile client.

title: Feared by the Bad, Loved by the Good
description: Chuck defends a cigarette smuggler accused of murder; a high-powered lawyer tries to influence Alana; Laura is stunned when Valerie makes a shocking confession to her.

title: The Cost of Love
description: Leon represents an abused wife; Olivia and Chuck continue to clash over Jack Driscoll; Nina's husband hires Rob; Ben starts acting up at school.

title: Fair Is Foul
description: Abused wife Joan Millman kills her husband, and Leon enlists Chuck and Laura to take over the case; Alana and Leon bring in professional help for Ben; the RCMP are breathing down Chuck's neck in their investigation of Jack Driscoll.

title: The Firm
description: BRT & Associates considers bringing in another criminal lawyer to help Chuck; Olivia is approached by a woman's group to represent a journalist; Leon helps a colleague fighting for the family of miners killed in an accident.

title: Persons Living or Dead
description: Leon represents a group of miner's, angering Chuck who feels the firm can't afford the case; Laura represents Rob's cousin; Chuck and Olivia grow more distant.

title: Crossroads
description: Olivia represents a female lawyer denied a partnership at her firm; Leon continues with the miner's case, but Chuck demands BRT vote if they should continue with the case.

title: The Morning After
description: Leon and Rob continue on the miners' case; Alana oversees a child custody case; due to circumstance, Chuck finds himself going up against Leon in the miner's case.

title: No Holds Barred
description: Chuck and Leon battle each other in court, leading to hard feelings; Olivia joins an AIDS task force and encounters an old nemesis; Alana makes a controversial speech.

title: The Long and Winding Road
description: Olivia is determined to get Arthur Locke thrown off the task force; Rob and Laura grow closer; Leon's win causes Chuck to reevaluate his life and leaves town.

title: Last Rites: Part 1
description: Olivia is charged with murder for helping a friend with AIDS commit suicide. The firm rallies around, including her estranged husband Chuck, just back from Vancouver.

title: Last Rites: Part 2
description: Olivia murder trial concludes with a surprising result. Rob and Laura, as well as Chuck and Olivia find themselves at a crossroads with their relationship.
